result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dvija T Cardine

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dvija T Cardine in court.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Dvija T Cardine.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Review Hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.
DPA Progress Report, received and filed

Defendant Dvija T Cardine in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Right, jury instructions/elements and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Stark, Branch 17 for a review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Elements of the Offense, Received and Filed.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement, Received and Filed.

Defendant Dvija T Cardine in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing. Defense informed the Court that the defendant has completed TAD evaluation and are waiting to receive the report. Court ordered case adjourned for deferred prosecution agreement hearing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Dvija T Cardine in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
State advises the Court this case could resolve with possible DPA. Defense requests an adjournment to allow time for defendant to complete TAD evaluation. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DM, AW, and Crossroads Care Center of Milwaukee.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/22/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Dvija T Cardine in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/20/22 @ 2:30p
